intro: Schedonnardus texanus, commonly known as the Texas spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in prairie and woodland habitats. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellow in color. The species is noted for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local wildlife.
